events.title: Battle of Lepanto
events.description: A fleet of the Holy League, a coalition of European Catholic maritime states, decisively defeated the Ottoman Empire's fleet in the Gulf of Patras.
events.significance: This battle marked the turning point in the naval dominance of the Mediterranean by the Ottomans and halted their westward expansion into Europe.

events.title: Einstein's Theory of General Relativity Confirmed
events.description: Astronomer Sir Arthur Eddington announced the confirmation of Einstein's theory of general relativity through observations during a solar eclipse.
events.significance: This confirmation revolutionized physics, altering our understanding of gravity and spacetime and establishing Einstein's reputation.

events.title: Foundation of the German Democratic Republic
events.description: The German Democratic Republic (East Germany) was officially established as a socialist state within the Soviet bloc after World War II.
events.significance: The establishment marked a key moment in Cold War geopolitics, symbolizing the division of Germany and Europe into East and West.

events.title: U.S. and Allied Forces Invade Afghanistan
events.description: The United States launched Operation Enduring Freedom against Taliban forces in Afghanistan in response to the September 11 attacks.
events.significance: This marked the beginning of the War on Terror and a significant military engagement that lasted two decades.
